intro: Jumellea alionae, commonly known as the alionae jumellea, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent leaves and deep root system. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the dry season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Jumellea alionae is considered a vulnerable species.
